p.strong:
Hello and welcome to our survey!
Your opinions are very important to us and thank you in advance for your participation.
Please answer each question carefully and completely. Remember there are no right or wrong answers.
Use the scroll bar on the right and bottom of your screen to move up and down through questions and images.
Let’s begin…

radio.label: S_Gender
radio.title: Please select the option that best represents your gender.

text.label: SelfIdentifyGender_OE
text.title: Please describe your identity below:

select.label: S_Region
select.title: Which state do you reside in?

row.label: r1
row.autofill: (S_Region.ch7 or S_Region.ch19 or S_Region.ch21 or S_Region.ch29 or S_Region.ch30 or S_Region.ch32 or S_Region.ch38 or S_Region.ch39 or S_Region.ch45)

radio.label: S_ChannelShopper2
radio.title: You mentioned that when you recently bought allergy relief products, you got them online. How did you receive these products you bought online?
radio.row: They were shipped from the store to my home within a few days
They were delivered the same-day that I placed the order
I ordered them online and picked them up from inside the store
I ordered them online and picked them up curbside, without going in the store

checkbox.label: S_ChannelShopper3
checkbox.title: Why did you select this method of receiving your online purchase of allergy relief products?
checkbox.row: This is how I usually shop
I could not stop at the physical store
I do not usually go to the store
It was the fastest way to get the products
I wanted to avoid delivery fees
I was tired/run down, so I didn't want to go in a store
Members of my household were sick so I had to purchase from home
I had too much on my plate so could not make the time to go to the store
It is more accessible than navigating a store to shop

block.label: AgreementBlock
block.note: THIS QUESTION SHOULD BE LEFT IN TO ENSURE QUALITY OF INTERVIEWING AND THAT IT'S NOT A BOT TAKING THE SURVEY

radio.label: Agreement1
radio.title:
Respondent Confidentiality Disclosure Agreement (RCDA)
Congratulations!
Thank you for agreeing to participate in this consumer study on behalf of Behaviorally. Before you can participate in this research, we would like you to understand that it will involve Confidential Information and you must agree to these terms and conditions. If you do not agree, you will not be eligible to participate in this study. By signing this agreement, you agree as follows:
You will hold in confidence any information about the products or packaging that may be disclosed to you directly or indirectly by participating in this research.
You will not discuss or otherwise reveal any of the information about the products or packaging disclosed to you with anyone other than the person administering the test.
You will use information disclosed to you only for the purpose of participating in this consumer study, and you will not otherwise use the information for your own benefit or the benefit of any third party.
You will be compensated for your time, commitment, and confidential obligation.
Please confirm your acceptance of these terms by checking the agreement below.

row.label: r1
row.b: I hereby acknowledge and agree to the terms.

text.label: DateTime
text.title: DateTime
text.exec:
from datetime import datetime
cur_time = datetime.now() DateTime.val = cur_time.strftime("%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S")

survey.html:
Thank you for your responses so far!
For the rest of this survey, we will be asking you about your experience shopping the allergy relief product category in the past one month.

text.label: Q_Beacon_Brand_only
text.title: Which brand do you most associate with Allergy Relief?

text.label: Q_Beacon_Brand1
text.title: Which brand do you most associate with the following allergy symptoms?
text.comment: Enter one brand for each symptom.

select.label: Q_Beacon_Brand2
select.title: Which of following brand do you most associate with the following allergy symptoms?

text.label: BRAND_OE1
text.title: You selected "Other Astepro" for Itchy eyes, please specify the brand.

text.label: BRAND_OE2
text.title: You selected "Other" for Itchy eyes, please specify the brand.

text.label: BRAND_OE3
text.title: You selected "Other Astepro" for Sinus pressure, please specify the brand.

text.label: BRAND_OE4
text.title: You selected "Other" for Sinus pressure, please specify the brand.

text.label: BRAND_OE5
text.title: You selected "Other Astepro" for Stuffy Nose/ Nasal Congestion, please specify the brand.

text.label: BRAND_OE6
text.title: You selected "Other" for Stuffy Nose/ Nasal Congestion, please specify the brand.

text.label: BRAND_OE7
text.title: You selected "Other Astepro" for Itchy rash, please specify the brand.

text.label: BRAND_OE8
text.title: You selected "Other" for Itchy rash, please specify the brand.

text.label: BRAND_OE9
text.title: You selected "Other Astepro" for Allergy Relief, please specify the brand.

text.label: BRAND_OE10
text.title: You selected "Other" for Allergy Relief, please specify the brand.

checkbox.label: Q_Missions
checkbox.title: Why did you decide to buy allergy relief products in the past month?
checkbox.row: I wanted to try something new, because my current allergy relief wasn't working for me
Someone in my household was experiencing allergy symptoms
I was trying to prevent allergy symptoms
I was replenishing – I had run out of allergy relief products
I was replenishing – I still had some at home but wanted to have more on hand
I was already at the store buying other things anyway

checkbox.label: Q_Pre_shop_activities
checkbox.title: In the past month, which of the following activities did you do before buying allergy relief products?
checkbox.row: Asked for a recommendation in a store from a pharmacist
Asked for a recommendation in store from a store associate
Contacted a healthcare professional (e.g. a doctor, nurse practitioner, etc.) for recommendations
Searched for recommendations online(e.g., google.com, etc.)
Checked my medicine cabinet to see what I had
Visited retailer websites (e.g., Walmart.com, Target.com, etc.) to review allergy relief products available
Visited Amazon.com/Amazon App to review allergy relief products available
Went to Instacart.com/Instacart App to review allergy relief products available
Considered recommendations from influencers, e.g. content creators on Instagram TikTok or Youtube
Went to online discussion boards/groups like Redditt or Facebook Community Groups for recommendations and reviews
Read informational articles on health websites, e.g., WebMD.com, Mayoclinic.com, etc.

row.label: r1
row.autofill: Q_Pre_shop_activities.r4 or Q_Pre_shop_activities.r10 or Q_Pre_shop_activities.r11 or Q_Pre_shop_activities.r12 or Q_Pre_shop_activities.r13

row.label: r2
row.autofill: Q_Pre_shop_activities.r6 or Q_Pre_shop_activities.r7 or Q_Pre_shop_activities.r8

row.label: r3
row.autofill: Q_Pre_shop_activities.r1 or Q_Pre_shop_activities.r2 or Q_Pre_shop_activities.r3 or Q_Pre_shop_activities.r9

textarea.label: Pre_shop_activities_1
textarea.title: Would you please name the influencers whose recommendations you considered?
textarea.comment: Please name as many influencers as you remember.
textarea.noanswer: I do not remember any names

survey.html: Now we would like you to tell us about the retailer you shopped at most recently, [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill] for allergy relief products.

checkbox.label: Q_RetailerSelectionFactors
checkbox.title: Why did you select [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill] for the allergy relief products you bought recently?
checkbox.row: The location is convenient to me
the website is convenient to use
I do my everyday retail shopping at [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill]
Prices at [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill] are better than others

row.label: r5
row.cond: Instore_online.r1 and not(Mostrecent_category.r5)

checkbox.row: It has a pharmacy counter at the store
There is a good selection of products
I can get in and out of the store quickly
The app is easy to use
I am able to purchase from home
I can have the products delivered quickly
I can purchase what I need quickly at this store
What I need is usually available at this store
I often find new things here
I can buy my allergy medication and everything else I need to feel well at this store

radio.label: Q_Post2
radio.title: How would you rate your experience shopping for allergy relief products at [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill]?

radio.label: Q_Post2B
radio.title: How likely are you to shop for allergy relief products at [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill] in the future?
radio.row: I would go back to [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill] for allergy relief products
I would shop at [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill] again, but not for allergy relief products
I would not go back to [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill] to shop for anything

checkbox.label: Q_RetailerTriggers
checkbox.title: Thinking about the allergy relief products you bought at [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill], which of the following experiences at the retailer motivated you to buy?
checkbox.row: I saw some products in a special display, e.g., at the end of an aisle
I saw or became aware of an in-store sale/promotion
I received a store coupon I wanted to use
I received a product coupon I wanted to use
It was on my store shopping list, e.g., on the store app
I saw something while checking out and decided to add it to my cart
I saw an advertisement promoting the product available at that store
I knew what I wanted to buy so nothing at the retailer impacted my purchase

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP8
checkbox.title: What issues, if any, have you experienced while shopping for allergy relief products at [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill]?
checkbox.row: Item I wanted was out of stock
Count size I wanted was not offered or available
Issues finding what I need in-store
Product cannot arrive for a few days (and I need it sooner)
Product I wanted was behind a protective barrier
Too many types of products to choose from, making it hard to decide
Product I wanted was located behind the pharmacy counter
I had to use my ID to purchase behind-the-counter allergy relief
The pharmacy was not open so I was unable to purchase behind-the-counter medications
Product I wanted was not available online

checkbox.label: Q_ProtectiveBarrier
checkbox.title: When the product you wanted was behind a protective barrier, which of the following did you do?
checkbox.row: Pushed a button to call a store employee to assist me
Had to find a store employee to assist me
Purchased a different product that was more easily accessible

checkbox.label: Q_ProtectiveBarrier2
checkbox.title: What are your feelings towards protective barriers in stores?
checkbox.row: I recognize the importance of them
They are frustrating and making shopping more difficult
I appreciate them for safety reasons
They make me reconsider purchasing products
I don't understand why they are needed
If I know a retailer has them on the products I want, I avoid that retailer

block.label: Q_DecisionFactors
block.builder:title: Question – DecisionFactors

number.label: Q_DecisionFactors_Version
number.title: Q_DecisionFactors - MaxDiff Version

radio.label: Q_DecisionFactors_[loopvar: task]
radio.title:
Task [MDcount]/10
We would now like to understand which factors are MOST and LEAST important to you when deciding to buy allergy relief products.
radio.comment: In this exercise you will see several different sets of six factors each. Some factors may get repeated over different sets. Each time you see a set, please drag from the boxes on the left to the boxes on the right, the factors that are MOST IMPORTANT and LEAST IMPORTANT to you in that set.
radio.exec: setupMaxDiffItemsI( Q_DecisionFactors_md, "v%d_t%d" % (Q_DecisionFactors_Version.val, [loopvar: task]), Q_DecisionFactors_[loopvar: task]) p.MDcount = str(Q_DecisionFactors_md_loop_expanded.order.index([loopvar: task]-1)+1)

block.label: block_Conjoint
block.exec:
print p.markers for x in p.markers: if ("/conjoint/dcm_" in x): hidVersion.val = int(x.split("_")[-1]) break
if hasMarker("/orderDCM/DCMorder1"): hidDCMorder.val = 1 if hasMarker("/orderDCM/DCMorder2"): hidDCMorder.val = 2 if hasMarker("/orderDCM/DCMorder3"): hidDCMorder.val = 3

number.label: hidDCMorder
number.title: Hidden to punch DCM order assigned

autofill.label: S_ChannelShopper_DCM
autofill.title: Conjoint question text.
autofill.row: In this section we would like you to imagine you are about to buy allergy products. You will see a range of different offers presented, please select the offer that you would buy.

row.label: r2
row.autofill: not device.desktop

radio.label: Q_Decision_Categories_[loopvar: task]

checkbox.label: Q_OTHERCATEGORIES_Purchase
checkbox.title: When shopping for allergy relief products at [pipe: RETAILER_LeastFill], which other types of products did you also buy, if any?
checkbox.row: Sleep aids (e.g. ZzzQuil, melatonin supplements, etc.)
Vitamins, minerals, or supplements (e.g. zinc supplements, Vitamin C, immune support,etc.)
Devices like air purifiers, filters, or humidifiers
Homeopathic remedies (e.g. manuka or raw honey)
Nasal rinse device (e.g. NetiPot, Neil Med Sinus Rinse)

radio.label: Q_SHOP1A
radio.title: How long were you experiencing allergy symptoms prior to shopping for allergy relief products?
radio.row: I was just starting to experience symptoms
I had been experiencing symptoms for a few days
I had been experiencing symptoms for a week or longer
I did not experience symptoms prior to shopping for allergy relief products.
I was not experiencing symptoms yet but expected to soon

radio.label: Q_SHOP1B
radio.title: How many days did you wait before shopping for allergy relief products?

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP1C
checkbox.title: Which of the following best describes the reasons why you waited to buy allergy relief products?
checkbox.row: I thought it was a cold at first before realizing it was allergies
The symptoms were not that severe/I was too busy and didn't have time to shop
I used natural remedies (e.g. honey, tea) instead of OTC products
I wanted to avoid taking products
I already had products on hand at home
I was hoping the symptoms would go away on their own
I didn't have time to purchase sooner
I saw a doctor who recommended I purchase products to treat my allergy symptoms

block.label: Section5
block.html: Thank you for telling us about your experiences shopping for allergy relief medication. For these next few questions, we'd like to understand how you felt and what you did during your recent allergies.

checkbox.label: S_SickBehavior
checkbox.title: Consider your recent experience of allergies and select a stage at which you have done each of the following activities.
checkbox.comment: Select at least one option per row
checkbox.col: At the first sign of allergy symptoms
As allergy symptoms started to go away
I do not do this at all
checkbox.row: Took product(s) I already had to help treat my allergies
Bought product(s) to help treat my allergies
Tried to avoid the allergens that trigger my symptoms
Got medical treatment (e.g. from a doctor, etc.)

radio.label: Q_Post1
radio.cond: S_SickBehavior.c1.r1 or S_SickBehavior.c2.r1 or S_SickBehavior.c3.r1 or S_SickBehavior.c4.r1 or S_SickBehavior.c1.r2 or S_SickBehavior.c2.r2 or S_SickBehavior.c3.r2 or S_SickBehavior.c4.r2
radio.title: After taking allergy relief product(s), how soon did you begin to feel symptom relief?
radio.row: I did not feel full relief after taking the allergy relief products

checkbox.label: Q_Post1B
checkbox.title: What did you do after you took allergy relief product(s)?
checkbox.row: I continued to take the allergy relief product(s) I had purchased
I bought more of the same allergy relief products I had taken
I bought something different from the same brand(s)
I bought a similar product from different brand(s)
I waited for symptoms to go away on their own
I went to a doctor or other medical professional
I used other products I had in my medicine cabinet
I used non-medicated remedies such as tea or herbal supplements
I used immune support products to help me feel better sooner

radio.label: Q_ReliefFinder
radio.title: When shopping for allergy relief products, did you use a relief finder app or website online (similar to the one pictured here)?
radio.row: Yes, I used a relief finder application online/on my phone
No, I did not use a relief finder application online/on my phone
No, but I'm interested in learning more about these applications

radio.label: Q_ReliefFinder_Yes
radio.title: Did you find the relief finder to be useful?

radio.label: Q_Prevention
radio.title: Do you shop for products to prevent allergy symptoms before a certain season or when you know you may be exposed to certain trigger(s)?

checkbox.label: Q_Prevention2
checkbox.title: Which, if any, of the following solutions have you used to avoid or minimize the onset of allergies in the past 12 months?
checkbox.row: Vitamins, minerals, or supplements (e.g. zinc supplements, Vitamin C, etc.)
Devices like air purifiers, filters, or humidifiers

radio.label: Q_Packaging
radio.title: When purchasing allergy relief products, how important are the following packaging attributes?
radio.comment: Select one response per packaging attribute.

radio.label: S_DemandSpaces
radio.title: When you last purchased products for Allergy, which of these statements better explains how you used them after purchase?
radio.row: My allergy symptoms were getting in the way of my ability to perform and carry on with my activities through my day, so I took the product(s) to quickly relief my symptoms so I could keep going.
My allergy symptoms were interrupting an otherwise good day, so I took the product(s) to relax and get back to enjoying myself.

I was experiencing strong allergy symptoms, and I took product(s) to help me feel better, so I could feel stronger and continue to make a difference for people I care about. When I feel like this, sometimes I also take some non-OTC/natural solutions.
My allergy symptoms were stressing me out - I wanted to "target" them with something that I could feel working, so I took a product(s) that provided relief for my specific symptoms.
My severe allergy symptoms lingered for so long… I feel like they were taking over. I wanted to get back in the "driver's seat", so I took a product(s) to help me re-gain control.

I was starting to experience allergy symptoms (or my symptoms were mild), so I was feeling "off". I took a product(s) to help me re-gain clarity. When I feel like this, sometimes I also take some non-OTC/natural solutions.

I know allergies were about to hit me (I knew they were coming, even though I wasn't experiencing symptoms then), so I took an allergy product to get ahead of my symptoms/prevent them from appearing or acting out.

radio.label: S_Experience
radio.title: We’d like to better understand your experience with seasonal/respiratory allergies. Please read through these statements and choose the one that best describes you. We understand no one statement will describe your experience perfectly.
radio.row: My Allergies aren’t a big deal. I don’t get them that much, and when I do, I power through my symptoms until they go away.
I’ve been struggling with allergies for a while- and they have a pretty big impact on my life. It feels like I’ve tried everything and this is just as good as it gets.
I’ve had allergies for a while- but I have it under control. I know how to treat them and I stay on top of it.

I’m relatively new to allergies and I’m still figuring it all out.. Sometimes it can be a little overwhelming, but I’m working on it- going to doctors, exploring prevention and trying to get a handle on this.
I’ve been dealing with allergies for some time- and they have a pretty big impact on my life. I am committed to finding the optimal solution… I'll try anything if I can afford it
I’ve had allergies for a few years now.. I do the research, go to the doctor and do what I need to do to keep them under control. “I’m sorted for now, but always exploring to find the absolute best
